text: Is there a way to fix this deprecating message?
Yeah, don't use that module :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing: but no there isn't a way. Custom HubL module and drag and drop templates are super outdated
Unfortunately, I don't think so. Why are you moving off of HubDB? Just curious

Hi,
I have created one template file in templates folder locally, now I want to push that file in HubSpot theme, How can I do that?
npx hs upload test-theme/src/templates/basic-template-demo.html test-theme/src/templates/basic-template-demo.html
But it is not working, is there any other syntax for uploading single file?

Does anyone know of a way to render dnd HTML markup in a non-dnd area of a template, other than trying to manually mimic it? i.e. a hardcoded dynamic template that should be all or mostly uneditable, but we still want to maintain consistent HTML markup with dnd sections.

So if you have a HubDB dynamic page with dnd sections, and you are setting some content values dynamically from a HubDB table, and the user edits a different section on the page, it essentially freezes the template content, so the dynamically generated section using HubDB table data will no longer update when the HubDB table updates?

Is there any way to disable modifying basically everything in a dnd template in the page editor? I see we can use `overrideable=false` for modules, but that doesnâ€™t work for or account for sections/columns/rows. One solution would be to use `overrideable=false` on the modules and not use dnd areas, but it goes along with this question <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PU4LV8/p1676764111489009>, where I want to keep the HTML markup consistent with normal drag and drop areas. Would be nice if we could use `{% section %}`, `{% column %}`, and `{% row %}` (non-dnd variants).
